description.narrative: Output 33: An additional 125,000 children in basic schools in 5 most deprived regions use WASH services in line with the Child Friendly Schools Model

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

title.narrative: Ghana United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ghana Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 33: An additional 125,000 children in basic schools in 5 most deprived regions use WASH services in line with the Child Friendly Schools Model

description.narrative: A draft national costed strategy to provide WASH facilities and education programmes for all Ghanaian schoolchildren was developed and incorporated into the draft Education Sector Plan. Strategy elements demonstrated at scale included simple, low-cost handwashing facilities (500,000 schoolchildren); a menstrual hygiene management communication package and sustainable water and sanitation facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of children in basic schools with adequate WASH facilities in line with national Child Friendly School standards as a result of UNICEF interventions
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Schools at which WASH facilities have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Costed National Strategy for universal access to school WASH facilities and programmes

actual.value: 2017:Draft strategy validated by stakeholders and expecting final National Costed strategy for WASH in Schools by 30th December
